Name: objectProducedByAgent
Description: Return the objects that were produced, in whole or in part, by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?object WHERE {   BIND(<%current%> as ?who)   ?object a crm:E22_Human-Made_Object ; crm:P108i_was_produced_by ?prod .   ?prod crm:P9_consists_of*/crm:P14_carried_out_by ?who .  }
Example: From the record for Rembrandt, the record for The Night Watch would be in the response

Name: objectEncounteredByAgent
Description: Return the objects that were discovered or encountered by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?object WHERE {   BIND(<%current%> as ?who)   ?object a crm:E22_Human-Made_Object ; sci:O19i_was_object_encountered_at ?enc .   ?enc crm:P9_consists_of*/crm:P14_carried_out_by ?who .  }
Example: From the record for O.C. Marsh, the record for the Torosaurus holotype would be in the response

Name: objectCuratedByAgent
Description: Return the objects that are curated, looked after, or otherwise are in the custody of the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?object WHERE {   BIND(<%current%> as ?who)   {     ?object a crm:E22_Human-Made_Object ; la:member_of ?coll .     ?coll crm:P16i_was_used_for ?curating .     ?curating crm:P14_carried_out_by ?who .    } UNION {     ?object crm:P50_has_current_keeper ?who .   } }
Example: From the record for the Paintings Department of the Rijksmuseum, the record for The Night Watch would be in the response.

Name: objectOwnedByAgent
Description: Return the objects that are owned by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?object WHERE {   BIND(<%current%> as ?who)   ?object a crm:E22_Human-Made_Object ; crm:P52_has_current_owner ?who . }
Example: From the record for the Rijksmuseum, the record for The Night Watch would be in the response.

Name: workCreatedByAgent
Description: Return the works that were created, in whole or in part, by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {   BIND(<%current%> as ?who)     ?work crm:P94i_was_created_by ?cre .         ?cre crm:P9_consists_of*/crm:P14_carried_out_by ?who . }
Example: From the record for André Chastel, the record for The Vatican Frescoes of Michelangelo would be in the response.

Name: workAboutAgent
Description: Return the works that are about or have a subject of the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {    BIND(<%current%> AS ?who)    ?work crm:P129_is_about ?who . }
Example: From the record for Abraham Lincoln, the record for We are Lincoln Men : Abraham Lincoln and his Friends would be in the response.

Name: workPublishedByAgent
Description: Return the works that are published by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {    BIND(<%current%> AS ?who)     ?work crm:P16i_was_used_for ?pub .    ?pub crm:P14_carried_out_by ?who . }
Example: From the record for Bloomsbury Publishing, the record for Alias Grace would be in the response.

Name: workRepresentsAgent
Description: Return the visual works that represent or depict the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {    BIND (<%current%> AS ?who)    ?work crm:P138_represents ?who . }
Example: From the record for Sarah Hope Harvey Trumbull, the record for Sarah Trumbull with a Spaniel would be in the response.

Name: groupFoundedByAgent
Description: Return the groups that were founded by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?group WHERE {   BIND (<%current%>AS ?who).   ?group crm:P95i_was_formed_by ?formation .   ?formation crm:P14_carried_out_by ?who . }
Example: From the record for Katherine Dreier, Man Ray or Marcel Duchamps, the group Societe Anonyme would be in the response

Name: agentMemberOfGroup
Description: Return the people or groups that are members of the group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?member WHERE {   BIND (<%current%> AS ?group).   ?member crm:P107i_is_current_or_former_member_of ?group . }
Example: From the record for Societe Anonyme, Katherine Dreier and Fortunato Depero would all be in the response

Name: conceptInfluencedByAgent
Description: Return the concepts that were influenced by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?concept WHERE {   ?concept crm:P94i_was_created_by ?creation .   ?creation crm:P15_was_influenced_by <%current%>. }
Example: From the record for Rembrandt, the record for the concept 'Rembrandt -- Aesthetics' would be in the response

Name: setCreatedByAgent
Description: Return the sets or collections that were created, in whole or in part, by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?set WHERE {   ?set crm:P94i_was_created_by ?creation .    ?creation crm:P15_was_influenced_by <%current%>. }
Example: From the record for O.C. Marsh, the record for his archive would be in the response

Name: activityParticipantAgent
Description: Return the activities in which the person or group participated but did not carry out directly.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?activity WHERE {  ?activity crm:P11_had_participant <%current%>.  }
Example: From the record for Tristan Tzara, the record for Cabaret Voltaire would be in the response.

Name: activityCarriedOutByAgent
Description: Return the activities that were carried out by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?activity WHERE {  BIND (<%current%>AS ?group).  ?activity crm:P14_carried_out_by ?group .   }
Example: From the record for the National Gallery of Art, the record for the Manet exhibition activity would be in the response

Name: objectProductionInfluencedByAgent
Description: Return the objects whose production was influenced by the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?objects WHERE {  ?objects crm:P108i_was_produced_by ?production .  ?production crm:P15_was_influenced_by <%current%>.  }
Example: From the record for Albert Bierstadt, the prints of his works (which were not necessarily created by him) would be in the response

Name: workAboutOrRepresentsAgent
Description: Return the works that are either about or depict the person or group.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {   {     ?work crm:P138_represents <%current%>.   }   UNION   {     ?work crm:P129_is_about <%current%>.   } }
Example: From the record for John Trumbull, the visual items and texts that depict him (such as a bibliographic record and a self-portrait) would be in the response

Name: objectProducedAtPlace
Description: Return the objects that were produced, in whole or in part, at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?object WHERE {   BIND(<%current%> as ?where)   ?object a crm:E22_Human-Made_Object ;        crm:P108i_was_produced_by/crm:P9_consists_of*/crm:P7_took_place_at ?where .  }
Example: From the record for Amsterdam, the record for The Night Watch would be in the response

Name: objectEncounteredAtPlace
Description: Return the objects that were encountered at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?object WHERE {     BIND(<%current%> as ?where)     ?object a crm:E22_Human-Made_Object ;         sci:O19i_was_object_found_by/crm:P9_consists_of*/crm:P7_took_place_at ?where .  }
Example: From the record for the Burgess Shale, the record for Anomalocaris Canadiensis would be in the response

Name: workCreatedAtPlace
Description: Return the works that were created, in whole or in part, at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {   BIND(<%current%> as ?where)   ?work crm:P94i_was_created_by/crm:P9_consists_of*/crm:P7_took_place_at ?where .  }
Example: From the record for Oxford UK, the Lord of the Rings and the Hobbit would be in the response

Name: workPublishedAtPlace
Description: Return the works that were published at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {     BIND(<%current%> as ?where)     ?activity ^crm:P16i_was_used_for ?work ;         crm:P2_has_type <http://vocab.getty.edu/aat/300054686> ;         crm:P9_consists_of*/crm:P7_took_place_at ?where . }
Example: From the record for Los Angeles, the Getty Exhibition catalog for Pacific Standard Time would be in the response

Name: objectCurrentPlace
Description: Return the objects that are, as far as the system knows, currently at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?object WHERE {     BIND(<%current%> as ?where)     ?object a crm:E22_Human-Made_Object ;         crm:P55_has_current_location ?where }
Example: From the record for Getty's gallery W204, the record for Jeanne (Spring) would be in the response

Name: workAboutPlace
Description: Return the works that are about or have a subject of the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {   BIND(<%current%>as ?where)   ?work crm:P129_is_about ?where .  }
Example: From the record for Paris France, the record for Victor Hugo's work "Paris" would be in the response

Name: workRepresentsPlace
Description: Return the visual works that represent or depict the place.
SPARQL: PREFIX crm: <http://www.cidoc-crm.org/cidoc-crm/> SELECT DISTINCT ?work WHERE {   BIND(<%current%>as ?where)   ?work crm:P138_represents ?where .  }
Example: From the record for Paris France, the record for Pissarro's "Boulevard Montmartre at Night" would be in the response

Name: personBornAtPlace
Description: Return the people who were born at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?agent WHERE {   BIND(<%current%>as ?where)   ?agent crm:P98i_was_born ?birth .    ?birth crm:P7_took_place_at ?where . }
Example: From the record for Leiden, the record for Rembrandt would be in the response

Name: groupFormedAtPlace
Description: Return the groups that were formed at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?group WHERE {   BIND(<%current%>as ?where)   ?group crm:P95i_was_formed_by ?formation .    ?formation crm:P7_took_place_at ?where . }
Example: From the record for Los Altos California, the record for Apple Computers would be in the response

Name: personDiedAtPlace
Description: Return the people who died at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?person WHERE {   BIND(<%current%>as ?where)   ?person crm:P100i_died_in ?death .    ?death crm:P7_took_place_at ?where . }
Example: From the record for Amsterdam, the record for Rembrandt would be in the response

Name: groupDissolvedAtPlace
Description: Return the groups that were dissolved at the place.
SPARQL: SELECT DISTINCT ?group WHERE {   BIND(<%current%>as ?where)   ?group crm:P99i_was_dissolved_by ?dissolution .    ?dissolution crm:P7_took_place_at ?where . }
Example: From the record for New Haven Connecticut, the record for Société Anonyme would be in the response

Name: personActiveAtPlace
Description: Return the people who were active at the place.
Example: From the record for Arles France, the record for Vincent Van Gogh would be in the response

Name: groupActiveAtPlace
Description: Return the groups who were active at the place.
Example: From the record for Paris France, the record for Goupil & Cie would be in the response

Name: agentBornOrFormedAtPlace
Description: Return the people or groups who were born or formed at the place.
Example: From the record for Harlem, New York, the record for Ayize Jama-Everett would be in the response

Name: agentDiedOrDissolvedAtPlace
Description: Return the people or groups who died or were dissolved at the place.
Example: From the record for Harlem, New York, the record for Howard Johnson-1941-2021 would be in the response

Name: agentActiveAtPlace
Description: Return the people or groups who were active at the place.
Example: From the record for Harlem, New York, the record for A.Philip Randolph would be in the response

Name: agentResidentAtPlace
Description: Return the people or groups who are or were resident at the place.
Example: From the record for Brooklyn, New York the record for E.V. Day would be in the response

Name: placePartOfPlace
Description: Return the places which are part of the place.
Example: From the record for Île-de-France, the record for Paris would be in the response

Name: setCreatedAtPlace
Description: Return the sets which were created at the place.
Example: From the record for New Haven, the record for the set representing the Archives of O. C. Marsh would be in the response

Name: conceptInfluencedByPlace
Description: Return the concepts whose creation was influenced by the place.
Example: From the record for the Netherlands, the record for Dutch Golden Age Paintings would be in the response

Name: activityTookPlaceAtPlace
Description: Return the activities that took place at the place.
Example: From the record for New Haven, the record for the exhibition activity Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of Happiness would be in the response

Name: objectProductionInfluencedByPlace
Description: Return the objects whose production was influenced by the place.

Name: workAboutOrRepresentsPlace
Description: Return works that are about or depict the place.
Example: From the record for Paris, the records for the image carried by a painting of Notre Dame and the text of a book about the city would be in the response

Name: objectMadeOfMaterial
Description: Return the objects which are made of the material.
Example: From the record for Canvas, the record for The Night Watch would be in the response

Name: workLanguageLanguage
Description: Return the works that are written or in the language.
Example: From the record for English, the record for the Lord of the Rings would be in the response

Name: objectClassifiedAsConcept
Description: Return the objects that are classified as the concept.
Example: From the record for Paintings, the record for Sunflowers would be in the response

Name: objectProductionTechniqueConcept
Description: Return the objects whose production has a technique of the concept.
Example: From the record for Bronze Casting, the record for The Thinker would be in the response

Name: workClassifiedAsConcept
Description: Return the works that are classified as the concept.
Example: From the record for Impressionism, the record for the work of Van Gogh's "Irises" would be in the response

Name: workCreationTechniqueConcept
Description: Return the works whose creation has a technique of the concept.
Example: From the record for Sculpting, the record for the sculpture "Bather putting up her hair" would be in the response

Name: workAboutConcept
Description: Return the works that are about the concept.
Example: From the record for the concept of Democracy, the record for Diamond's work "In Search of Democracy" would be in the response

Name: workRepresentsConcept
Description: Return the visual works that represent or depict the concept, or an instance of the concept
Example: From the record for the concept of Dogs, the record for the work of the Night Watch would be in the response (as the image depicts an unidentified dog)

Name: agentClassifiedAsConcept
Description: Return the people or groups that are classified as the concept.
Example: From the record for the concept of the Dutch nationality, the record for Rembrandt would be in the response

Name: placeClassifiedAsConcept
Description: Return the places that are classified as the concept.
Example: From the record for the concept of Cities, the record for Amsterdam would be in the response

Name: activityClassifiedAsConcept
Description: Return the activities that are classified as the concept.
Example: From the record for the concept of Exhibitions, the record for "Manet and Modern Beauty" would be in the response

Name: conceptClassifiedAsConcept
Description: Return the concepts that are classified as the concept.
Example: From the record for the concept of Nationalities, the record for Dutch would be in the response

Name: conceptBroaderConcept
Description: Return the concepts that have a broader relationship to the concept (e.g. are narrower concepts)
Example: From the record for the concept for Visual Art object types, the record for Paintings would be in the response

Name: conceptInfluencedByConcept
Description: Return the concepts that are influenced by the concept.
Example: From the record for the concept of History, the record for History of France would be in the response

Name: setClassifiedAsConcept
Description: Return the sets that are classified as the concept.
Example: From the record for the concept of Auction Lots, the record for Lot 14 would be in the response

Name: workAboutOrRepresentsConcept
Description: Return the works that are about or depict the concept.
Example: From the record for the concept of Law and Order, the record for the work of the Night Watch would be in the response

Name: entityMemberOfSet
Description: Return entities which are members of the set.
Example: From the record for the Getty's painting department's objects, the record for Spring would be in the response

Name: objectMemberOfSet
Description: Return objects which are members of the set.
Example: From the record for the Rijksmuseum's highlight objects, the record for the Night Watch would be in the response

Name: workMemberOfSet
Description: Return works which are members of the set.
Example: From the record for the set of works which describe the Night Watch, the record for Bikker's "The Night Watch" would be in the response

Name: placeMemberOfSet
Description: Return places which are members of the set.
Example: From the record for the set of places in which Van Gogh lived, the record for Arles would be in the response

Name: conceptMemberOfSet
Description: Return concepts which are members of the set.
Example: From the record for the AAT concept scheme (a Set), the record for AAT's Primary Name concept would be in the response

Name: temporalMemberOfSet
Description: Return periods, events and activities which are members of the set.
Example: From the record for the set of Linked Art face to face meetings, the record for the second face to face meeting in Oxford would be in the response

Name: workAboutSet
Description: Return works which are about the set.
Example: From the record for the set for the Archives of O. C. Marsh, a text of an article about the archives would be in the response

Name: workRepresentsSet
Description: Return visual works which represent or depict the set.
Example: From the record for the set for the Archives of O. C. Marsh, an image that depicts the archive would be in the response

Name: activityUsedSet
Description: Return activities which used the set.
Example: From the record for the set of objects shown in an exhibition, the record for the exhibition's activity would be in the response

Name: setMemberOfSet
Description: Return the sets which are members of the set.
Example: From the record for the set for the Archives of O. C. Marsh, the record for Series 1 within that archive would be in the response

Name: conceptInfluencedBySet
Description: Return concepts which were influenced by the set.

Name: workAboutOrRepresentsSet
Description: Return the works which are about or represent the set.
Example: From the record for the set for the Archives of O. C. Marsh, the records for an article about the archive and an image of the archive would be in the response

Name: objectProductionCausedByActivity
Description: Return the objects whose production was caused by the event or activity.
Example: From the record for a commission activity, the record for the object that was produced because of the commission would be in the response

Name: workCreationCausedByActivity
Description: Return the works whose creation was caused by the event or activity.
Example: From the record for a conference activity, the record for the proceedings of the conference would be in the response

Name: setCreationCausedByActivity
Description: Return the sets whose creation was caused by the event or activity.

Name: personDeathCausedByActivity
Description: Return the people whose death was caused by the event or activity.
Example: From the record for the Bubonic Plague, the record for a person who died of the plague would be in the response

Name: objectDestructionCausedByActivity
Description: Return the objects whose destruction was caused by the event or activity.
Example: From the record for a fire that destroyed a museum, the record for an object destroyed in the fire would be in the response

Name: conceptCreationCausedByActivity
Description: Return the concepts whose creation was caused by the event or activity.

Name: activityCausedByActivity
Description: Return the activities that were caused by the event or activity.
Example: From the record for a fire that damaged a statue, the record for the conservation activity to repair the statue would be in the response

Name: activityPartOfActivity
Description: Return the periods, events or activities that were part of the period, event or activity.
Example: From the record for the Bronze Age, the record for the Middle Bronze Age would be in the response

Name: workAboutActivity
Description: Return the works that are about or have a subject of the period, event or activity.
Example: From the record for the Bronze Age, the record for a work about the Bronze Age would be in the response

Name: workRepresentsActivity
Description: Return the works that are represent or depict the period, event or activity.
Example: From the record for the activity of the Battle of Bunker Hill, the record for the image created by Trumbull of the painting of the same name would be in the response

Name: conceptInfluencedByActivity
Description: Return the concepts that were influenced by the period, event or activity.
Example: From the record for the 15th Century (a Period), the record for the History of France in the 15th Century would be in the response

Name: workAboutOrRepresentsActivity
Description: Return the works that are about or represent the period, event or activity.
Example: From the record for the activity of the Battle of Bunker Hill, the records for the text of an article about it and the image of Trumbull's painting would both be in the response

Name: objectPartOfObject
Description: Return the objects that are part of the object.
Example: From the record for the Night Watch, the record for the frame of the Night Watch would be in the response

Name: conceptInfluencedByObject
Description: Return the concepts that were influenced by the object.
Example: From the record for the Night Watch, the concept of the Reception of the Night Watch in the 19th Century would be in the response

Name: objectProductionInfluencedByObject
Description: Return the objects whose production was influenced by the object.
Example: From the record a painting that was copied, the record for the copy would be in the response

Name: workAboutObject
Description: Return the works that are about or have a subject of the object.
Example: From the record for the Night Watch, the record for Bikker's "The Night Watch" would be in the response

Name: workRepresentsObject
Description: Return the visual works that represent or depict the object.
Example: From the record for the Night Watch, the record for a photograph of the Night Watch would be in the response

Name: activityUsedObject
Description: Return the activities that used the object.
Example: From the record for the Night Watch, the record for the conservation work on the painting would be in the response

Name: workAboutOrRepresentsObject
Description: Return the works that are about or represent the object.

Name: objectCarriesWork
Description: Return the objects that carry the linguistic work.
Example: From the record for the Lord of the Rings, the record for the copy in the British Library would be in the response

Name: objectShowsWork
Description: Return the objects that show the visual work.
Example: From the record for the image of the Night Watch, the record for the painting would be in the response

Name: workPartOfWork
Description: Return the works that are part of the work.
Example: From the record for The Lord of the Rings, the record for The Fellowship of the Ring would be in the response

Name: conceptInfluencedByWork
Description: Return the concepts that were influenced by the work.
Example: From the record for The Lord of the Rings, the record for the concept of the History of Middle-Earth would be in the response

Name: workAboutWork
Description: Return the works that are about or have a subject of the work.
Example: From the record for The Lord of the Rings, the record for an article about Tolkien's work would be in the response

Name: workRepresentsWork
Description: Return the works that represent or depict the work.

Name: activityUsedWork
Description: Return the activities that used the work.

Name: objectProductionInfluencedByWork
Description: Return the objects whose production was influenced by the work.

Name: workAboutOrRepresentsWork
Description: Return the works that are either about or represent the work.
